The total number of commutative operations should therefore be $5^{5} \times 5^{10} = 5^{15}$ , not $5^{10}$ . Proof: In order to show that $f^*(U_1 \times ... \times U_k) = \bigcap_{i=1}^k f^*_i(U_i)$ , we have to show that each of the sets is a subset of the other. Let $a \in f^*(U_1 \times ... \times U_k)$ . We have that $f(a) \in U_1 \times ... \times U_k$ . Then $f(a)=(u_1,...u_k)$ with $u_i \in U_i$ for each $i \in \{1,...,k\}$ .
